website_summaries.verdict: We love that the fabric is as soft as a favorite t-shirt, is simple to use, and is liked by moms who are breastfeeding or who have had a c-section.
pros: The sling isn't difficult to wrap, is soft, and lacks complicated straps and buckles
It folds into a small size, making it easy to toss into a diaper bag
cons: The fabric can get too warm for some parents' liking, and sizing runs small

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely love this carrier
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this carrier! It's super easy to put on and get the baby in! I'm still trying to figure out how to breastfed in it but we've almost got that down! I also love that there's a little pocket on the front 😊 It's such a beautiful pattern and I always get compliments when I wear it!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Kari

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love it. I really did.
customer_reviews.text: Man, I had the hardest time putting this on. Ordered it bc it was supposed to be super user friendly. Tried watching tutorials, practiced with my husband. Tried XS and S. One was too small and the other one was too big. I might have not adjusted the fabric the right way (around shoulders) but it was too much of a hassle. Ain't nobody got time for that. Not as much back support as Ergo Baby 360.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria I. Felkl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I’m typically a size medium, but I ordered a small because of the reviews claiming it would stretch. There was absolutely nothing stretchable about this wrap and it was awkwardly loose in certain areas. Not only was it extremely uncomfortable for me, but for my baby as well who cried the entire time she was in it. I followed the directions received in the wrap, as well as countless videos and I was still unable to get my baby fully supported to where I felt comfortable walking hands-free.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica B.

customer_reviews.title: Black material stiff
customer_reviews.text: I am 4’11 and currently 112lbs - I ordered the black XS for my 10lb baby and put it through the wash upon receipt - this thing is SNUG with not a lot of stretch and uncomfortable around the shoulders. It’s so stiff / tight on I had to get my husband to help me get it flat and tug my shirt sleeves down while the baby is in it. Not sure if other colors come in a more forgiving fabric, as by their size chart I am in the correct item.
customer_reviews.author: Theola H Wong

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, poor support, greedy seller
customer_reviews.text: Don't be cheated by the good reviews. This carrier seems great when I just put it on. However, after 20 minutes baby is hanging down low on my chest. The carrier does not support baby well so she slumps, which is very dangerous to the baby. The wrap is too stretchy to support any baby. But I realized this after I bought 2 wraps from this seller. I asked the seller if they could offer me a discount to buy a smaller new one, and of course, they refused. They made this wrap super stretchy to make money, so that moms like me have to buy their wrap again and again.
customer_reviews.author: HLM

customer_reviews.title: Not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I had the ktan wrap as a hand me down for my older child 4 years ago and LOVED it. I have bought one as a gift for every baby shower since I experienced the easy and comfortable baby wearing it brought me. I just got one new as a baby gift for my newborn and it's crap compared to the one I had (it went through at least 3 kids too!) 4 years ago. The fabric is now thin and not elastic making it very uncomfortable for both me and baby. We won't be using it and i'm super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Love this wrap, very easy to learn to use. We use it all the time. Very comfortable. I had a difficult time figuring out my sizing at first. I'm 5'2" and pre-pregnancy I was 125 lbs but now I'm 152. We ended up buying an XS for me and it was too tight so we kept the XS for when I loose some lbs and we bought a S for me and M for my husband. I feel like the small is still a little big on me because I'm short, but it works and feels comfortable and the extra piece of fabric that comes for added support is nice (it's actually the "bag" that the wrap comes in).
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Gaughran

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I have three carriers: soft structure, ring sling, and baby ktan, all of which I choose to use depending on the scenario. The baby ktan washes and does easily, is easy to put on, and fits well in a diaper bag. I am a size 10 and chose the medium, but would go with a small if I were to purchase again. I appreciate the versatility and comfort. If I were to choose just one carrier, this would be it.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Give it a chance even if you think It’s too small
customer_reviews.text: I almost returned when I tried it on with the baby. It does stretch out but not too much. I also have the ergo 360 and Boba wrap. This is so much easier. I actually just wear to around the house even if I’m not holding the baby. It’s easy to slip him in and out but also holds him securely. The beige at benefit is I can slip it on while holding him. The others require 2 hands. There are also a bunch of ways to carry the baby. One of my faves is as a sling over his swaddle when he is screeching and insisting on being carried (not held) while going down for naps or to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed
customer_reviews.text: All of the videos show this to be super stretchy, but it’s not. They say to order your size clothing, but that only worked when my baby was 7-9lbs. Once he got to about 10lbs, it’s way too tight for him to fit in. It doesn’t say anything about needing a bigger size as baby grows. He is just uncomfortable and cries.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Easier Than Most Wraps
customer_reviews.text: I bought a boba while pregnant and was super excited to use it. Unfortunately, it was pretty confusing, time consuming, and baby never felt secure in it. He actually cried each time I’d put him in. Not to mention it seemed way too big for me. In the k’tan I bought an XS (5ft8/115 pre-pregnancy/150 post-pregnancy/32b chest). It’s the perfect size, so I’d say the size chart is accurate. I watched some tutorials from their YouTube channel and got the hang of it immediately. Baby loves napping in this! So glad I decided to give this a chance after my bad experience with the boba.
customer_reviews.author: Macy Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great to use around my house for my baby that ...
customer_reviews.text: Great to use around my house for my baby that loves to be held. It's soft and easy to use, unlike all the wrap carriers that I can never figure out. The only thing that I don't like is the fact that it shrunk after I washed it...
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: My favorite baby purchase
customer_reviews.text: Our baby boy was born early and after finally bringing him home I needed something to help with Kangaroo Care. Most carriers were impractical due to his size and after consulting with his pediatrician we tried this one. I use it every day! I have always preferred a conventional carrier over wraps due to the hassle of taking baby in and out and this is the perfect solution. It takes me 30 seconds, baby loves being so close and it is comfortable for both of us. I love that the multiple positions allow it to grow with my little one.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Size chart is inaccurate
customer_reviews.text: Product is way to small. I bought a small since I’m a size 4US and according to size chart a S is up to size 8 dress size. I can barely squeeze my baby into it and the wrap cuts into his legs it’s so tight. Definitely buy a size up if you purchase because size chart is way off. Total waste of a purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Regobego

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but achy back
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on. I ordered this one because I was intimidated by complicated wraps. But it doesn’t take long for my lower back to ache. Maybe there is something to be said for the original wrap style that twists around your lower back? I haven’t tried one. Also K’tan is not adjustable so it feels like baby is super tight in wrap even though I ordered the right size according to my clothing. Maybe if there were height and weight recommendations I would discover I’m not in the correct size but even a larger k’tan would have the same lower back ache complaint.
customer_reviews.author: BPBomber

customer_reviews.title: Kind of a waste
customer_reviews.text: This was not a useful purchase and I regret it. It's pretty difficult getting our baby in and out of it when he's awake, let alone if he falls asleep. I wouldn't suggest this. Buy a real baby carrier like an Ergo or Lillibaby instead. Much more practical.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Dodd

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and secure
customer_reviews.text: I've always wondered how secure these wraps were. I had a preemie and he was too small for my carrier so I had to give this a whirl. This has been perfect! Super easy to figure out and I have no worries of him slipping out. I was concerned about the size of this. I haven't worn an XS since high school and, after trying on clothes after having him, I was tired of not being able to fit in clothes, so I was very skeptical about an XS. I'm 5'4, 116lbs before baby and 120lbs after baby. I typically where a small, but the XS fits well, maybe just a hair too big.
customer_reviews.author: Bri

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t live upto the hype
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely excited to use this product. I did the entire research on the sizing and I can tell you the baby katan as per their advise was simply uncomfortable n smothering. It looked too tight for the baby to fit in. In reality it was quite hard to insert the baby without squishing it- and am talking abt a 9lb baby. I know my review maybe countered that I was wearing the wrong size but I have ordered one that complies by the sizing guide. Returned the product!
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Loved so far!
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this so far for a newborn baby. It has helped to free up hands when going for walks and doing things around the house, also for comforting a colicky baby. It is very snug out of the box and apparently shrinks down a bit again with washing. With use, it stretches out. I have not washed it yet to see how much it would shrink back down. There are guides for finding the right size. The instructions also say to contact them regarding fit before you return it, so hopefully their customer service is accessible and helpful as well.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love this compared to all of the wrap-it-yourself type baby carriers. I have the ErgoBaby carrier which i really like, but this one is more comfortable for just wearing around the house. Definitely buy a size based on your pre-pregnancy size. I thought for sure it would be too small since I felt so large pregnant, but it fits just right. For reference, I was 5'4" 125 pre pregnancy and weighed about 165-170 when I delivered and the XS fits great
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Love It Now
customer_reviews.text: I hated this carrier for the kangaroo position that my baby was forced to be in for so long but as soon as she grew to the hug position I fell in love. It’s so nice to be able to carry her around and have her feel safe and secure on me. I will say you should size down because the sizing is not accurate. Plus the carrier stretches out with use. It does go back to it’s original shape when washed though. It’s so nice to be able to put her on and get stuff done!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Baggins

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: The material is very nicely weighted and probably holds the baby very well, but I couldn't tell you because I got the size according to the chart, and it's MUCH too small for me to use. It's certainly not very stretchy, or I might be able to make it work, but alas, with my chest being even larger due to breastfeeding (which I did try to take into account), it is too small. I'm hoping my husband may be able to make use of the smaller size while I try to find another size for me to use. However, now I'm nervous about spending more money on another size that might not work.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna M.

customer_reviews.title: Looks cute, but not the most practical.
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this baby carrier. The instructions are pretty confusing. I finally found some YouTube videos that were much easier to follow and made it much more simple to use. I guess the thing that has bugged me about it so far though is that it tends to fall forward after wearing it for about 20 minutes. I have to keep one hand under my baby to keep it totally in place, otherwise it pulls down on my shoulders and really starts to hurt. It looks super cute and is easy to use once you get the hang of it, but it's really only good for short periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Cody F.

customer_reviews.title: Material doesn't breath, sizing is very cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Material is heavy/rough feeling, not soft or stretchy. Don't get me wrong I want durable but material that brearhws would be ideal. Hesitated to purchase this, sizing was way too confusing. I purchased a medium and it feels big. Based on the chart I should be buying XL. Purchase with caution, you may need to return for sizing issues. Videos were helpful in deciding which one to purchase, specifically did not want a carrier that had to be tied. I found the instructions included a bit difficult to follow, even though the video looks straight forward. May return and not order smaller size, have not decided.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Mom!

customer_reviews.title: Great for moms intimidated by wraps!
customer_reviews.text: As a petite woman, I've had a hard time with wraps that are as long as I am tall. The K'Tan is a great solution -- I can have my baby in it in less than a minute without dealing with yards and yards of fabric. My baby loves being close to me, and I feel like he's secure and safe in the wrap. My only complaint is that it does wear my back out after long periods of use, but overall it's fairly comfortable and allows me to move freely while wearing my baby.
customer_reviews.author: C Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Material isn’t that stretchy
customer_reviews.text: I honestly think I ordered one size too small I’m 5’4 110 based on the reviews I assumed that would be my size also I wear size 0 in dresses since they state go off dress size but it was too small so I haven’t been able to enjoy it because I can’t use it! So I will definitely write an update review if I’m able to exchange it. But for now I’m supper bummed I can’t get my baby on it.
customer_reviews.author: ivonney

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'4" tall, weighing 133 lbs 4 weeks postpartum and ordered a size medium after trying on size small. Size small fit too tightly. My newborn fit in there a bit too snug and was about to grow out of it within a week probably. I had also previously tried a ring sling multiple times and ended up totally frustrated. So I am very happy to have found this, as size medium works great. Putting it on feels simple and quick after a few times. My beautiful baby falls asleep in it easily and I can breastfeed when she is in it, too. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Sent USED gross product
customer_reviews.text: I did not even attempt to try this product because the one sent was very obviously used. Long dark hairs in the box and once I unfolded the K'Tan, it had slime marks. White crusted stuff, tons of dog hair, lint and more hair. I immediately put it back in the box. I can go on a yard sale page if I wanted a USED product and pay less.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Best wrap for baby carrying!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! I’ve had a moby wrap (waaaay too long) and a Bjorn (only one way to carry) and THIS one is my favorite!! So easy to use, comes with a booklet explaining the different ways to carry, comes in a pouch that I can carry in baby girl’s diaper bag which folds inside-out to add an extra wrap piece. I can hold baby so she’s facing me, when she gets bigger there’s a way to hold her facing out the other direction, and I can also hold her where she’s laying down. Different options so she’s comfortable! So so soooo pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is weird.
customer_reviews.text: I went by the size chart, but once I washed it it was too small. It’s not stretching, baby boy is super uncomfortable. I’ve ordered a bigger size because it really is easy to use and I want it to work. Wish I could return a washed one because it’s still in new condition. Really hoping the bigger one works better, because it is super easy to use, and looks to be more comfortable and secure than the Moby I have. I’m 5’6 and my pre baby size was a 4, with a 10lb baby, XS was too small.
customer_reviews.author: Lovingessentialliving

customer_reviews.title: Too warm for baby and myself
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this but it ended up being way to warm for baby and myself. I was sweating bullets the entire time I was wearing it. Baby was getting super warm and flushed too. Returned and ordered the active k'tan instead. If the fabric would have been thinner and cooler I would have kept it and given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amd123

customer_reviews.title: Best thing about it is how easy it is to use!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best carrier I have ever owned. My favorite thing about is how easy it is to use. I tried different carries that wrap the baby like this, super close to me. I felt like I almost needed a degree to use it. But not with this one. This is super super easy and you find several tutorials online that will show you many ways that you can use. It is easy to wash (goes nice in the washer) and the color did not fade. It is not only for infants. You change the way you wear it and it fits larger kids. This is also very ergonomic.
customer_reviews.author: Debora B

customer_reviews.title: Very important Item to add this to your arsenal of baby stuff
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item for my DIL and she loves it! She was hesitant at first, but decided to give it a try. The learning curve was a little challenging at first. She watched YouTube and quickly learned. Easy to nurse in, and a great way to keep others germs away. Great to use to get more house cleaning done, and dinner made! Be sure to turn baby away from the stove or over when cooking to avoid burns. Important to know: babies that are worn sleep better, and cry 50% less! !!! Also important is wearing your baby encourages bonding. Sick baby? Strip yourself and baby down and baby’s fever will decrease. Buy this! You won’t regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Marianne

customer_reviews.title: Best baby wrap EVER!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best purchase I’ve made for my baby!!!!! I have tried several wraps, baby wear products and I have not been able to find anything that was quick and easy to wear, specially when you have a fussy newborn and don’t have much time on your hands. This wrap is sooo easy to put together and my baby falls asleep almost instantly while i have him in it!!!!! Overall this is an Awesome product and reasonably priced and amazing quality!!!!!! I also love that you can get different sizes to fit your body type which is great since many products out there are a one size fits all and sometimes that doesn’t work for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: michelle

customer_reviews.title: Just okay
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had several of these types of wraps. Thought this would be easy to put on and take off but with the multiple loops it’s honesty not any easier than a wrap that is one long piece of fabric that you tie. This comes with too separate pieces, and depending on how you are carrying baby you still have to tie a separate piece around your waste. Was also not confident it was tight/secure enough.
customer_reviews.author: eoleary19

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Even for fur moms :)
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for something to carry my pup around when she’s being clingy, but I’ve got stuff to do (or when she gets too tired on hikes). None of the doggy carriers worked and then I decided to check out the baby slings. The first one I tried was half the price but was ridiculously confusing and way too big and stretchy for my frame (and experience level with these wraps). Then I got this one and it’s Perfect! It was so much simpler to put on (though I admit it took a couple tries to get it right) and it was easy to slip her into it. She started falling asleep immediately haha
customer_reviews.author: AmbearTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Plus Size Mamas Beware!!!  RUNS SMALL
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking that it would fit me just right... I am a plus size Mama. It runs small and didn't fit me at all. Ended up making my own with Seersucker fabric.
customer_reviews.author: We3InTX

customer_reviews.title: Makes life with a newborn much easier!
customer_reviews.text: My favourite and most used baby item. Baby loves it and sleeps on me for hours while I’m wearing her. I have a toddler so I need free hands. It’s so comfortable and feels like a t shirt. I also use an Ergobaby for longer walks (I need the lumbar support) but this is what I use around the house/walking short distances. It’s so nice to keep baby close. I highly recommend! I’m 5’9” ~140lbs and I ordered a small. It fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Tessa Graves

customer_reviews.title: Game changer
customer_reviews.text: With my first I tried and tried to use a moby type carrier and never got comfortable with it. With my second I bypassed the moby style. She was a preemie and came home 5 pounds. She wouldn’t fit any of my other slings or carriers. Enter the Ka’Tan. It took twice to put it on and off to get the hang of it. My tiny baby was so secure and I could still put my toddler in my hip. Now at almost 4 months I still use it daily for my colicky girl. The material is firm and stretchy and washes so well. I would purchase this over and over again
customer_reviews.author: Sasha Star

customer_reviews.title: Pay extra money for brand names, its worth it
customer_reviews.text: I love how much easier this is then the Moby. Im not rushed and it fits the same each time. However. Im experiencing some back pain. First time qearing with baby more then we mins and I havent slept well and pumping is a nightmare. I doubt the pain is from the ktan. But I did buy a cheaper wrap before this one and it sucked!!! The material was thin and not wide enough to hold baby securely. So I returned it and bought this ktan. Much happier. I give it 4 before I. Not sure about about the back yet. Its pulling on my back.
customer_reviews.author: @Sacred7Senses

customer_reviews.title: One of our favorite baby items!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd baby k’tan. I bought this second one for my husband on a warehouse deal for our 2nd baby on the way. He can fit into mine, which we had for our 1st born, but having his own one size up will be much more comfortable for him as baby gets older. He was only able to use the smaller one until baby was about 2 months old. We love this carrier because it packs easy in the diaper bag, it’s so soft and comfortable for short outings, and if baby spits up on it, you can just throw it in the washer!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Fun at the beginning
customer_reviews.text: My newborn loved the kangaroo position. If I wasn’t able to calm her down, I put her in the wrap and started walking. Within 2 min she was quiet and another 5-10 min and she was asleep. I even was able to get her out of the wrap without waking her and put her to bed. Now that she is older (2.5 month), I feel that the wrap is too tight, even in the regular sitting position. I am only able to use it if she is in a good mood.
customer_reviews.author: Steffi

customer_reviews.title: I Love this baby carrier!!!.
customer_reviews.text: By far the best baby carrier I have ever owned! And I have tried many different baby carriers! I could literally use this for my 2 month old or for my 1 year old. So you know that this would last you a long time. The carrier is good quality! I love the material of it! I feel like it supports the baby very well. And it’s very comfortable for both baby and mom! The only thing I’m sad about is that they did not have the design that I originally wanted in stock in my size. But other than that I absolutely love this carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Xena Delgado

customer_reviews.title: Works great, runs small...
customer_reviews.text: I love this wrap. The only downfall is it does run small. I was right in between sizes so I went with smaller hoping it would either stretch some or not be too snug but definitely is. My 7 lb newborn fits perfect for now but I only see her fitting for a few more weeks before it will be impossible to get her in it. She does love though being so snug and close to my body. I was worried that I wouldn't feel like she was secure enough in it but I wear it while chasing my 18 month old around and its been great!
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Better than a traditional wrap!  More comfortable than a traditional carrier!
customer_reviews.text: I tried a couple different baby carriers. This wrap seemed to be the easiest and most comfortable and convenient carrier I tried.. as long as you try It in front of a mirror a couple times before using it, you’ll be fine! My son is now 6 months and it still feels secure and comfortable! We’ve been using it since he was about 3.5 months. I like the idea of the wraps but this is so much easier than a traditional wrap! Sometimes if your in a hurry the fabric gets twisted, and that can be uncomfortable. I wear a L/XL in tops.
customer_reviews.author: martyz4

customer_reviews.title: not baby’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased this product to use with our newborn. We have another carrier but I wanted to avoid purchasing a newborn insert and figured this would do the job. I was wrong, it’s advertised as birth and up, however they really mean 8 pounds once you read the safety details. This meant my 6 pounder was too small and would need another solution until he grew. Well he did grow and we tried multiple times to get him into the carrier but he hates it. He never enjoyed being swaddled and is uncomfortable in this carrier. I’ll keep trying every so often since babies constantly change but it’s disappointing only getting a few months of use, if any.
customer_reviews.author: Swiggle

customer_reviews.title: Alot better than the wraps
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is so easy to put on. I'm still learning all the different positions.. I've even tried nursing in it. Doesn't look comfortable for her so I haven't tried in a while. But I put this on to carry her with me to the mailbox or do chores around the house when she just wants to be close. With our bodies close together we get heated quick so be careful with that. It's winter time too 😂 my lo is only 10 weeks old so we will see how well it works as she gets bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: Order One Size Smaller than Size Guidelines
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'10" and 180 lbs. I wear a size 14 dress due to my large chest size (pre-pregnancy 38D), so I purchased the large size. Unfortunately, it was way too big. My 6 week old was so far down in it because it was way too loose. I am returning it and will try for a medium instead. I definitely suggest ordering one size down otherwise your baby will end up in a position that they deem 'unsafe' in the instruction manual. Otherwise I think it would work well. I will update my review once I get the medium and try it.
customer_reviews.author: Megkat10

customer_reviews.title: Great, but too small
customer_reviews.text: I used the size chart to decide what size I needed to get. According to the chart I should have an extra small. It worked fine when my son was a newborn, but once he started getting bigger it has become way too tight for him to be in comfortably. I also got a size small and the small works much better. Personally I couldn't find a comfortable way to let him breastfeed while he was in it. It's great for just carrying him around when I don't want to carry the car seat though.
customer_reviews.author: Callie D.

customer_reviews.title: So much easier to use compared to other carriers
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time baby wearing (2nd child) and I have already gone through two other wraps/carriers before someone recommend this one. If you are completely not coordinated like me with wrapping/twisting/inserting baby, this is the carrier for you! So easy to use, extremely easy instructions with step by step, and very comfortable for Mom and baby. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functional and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This product is a lifesaver. My newborn loves to be held and doesn’t like being put down for long. The Baby K’tan allows me to keep her happy, while also meeting the needs of my busy toddler and getting things done around the house. It’s a lot easier to use than other wraps I have tried in the past, and I love that there are no long tails of material to worry about. The material is light weight and keeps baby from getting too hot. I have recommended this wrap to friends who are expected or have young children and will continue to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Too small- squishes mom and baby!
customer_reviews.text: My only issue with this is that it’s small and not very stretchy. I’m not very big (size 1, 5ft 4in, 110lb). I cannot wear this with my baby because it squishes us in too tightly and we have no way to loosen the wrap. I was excited about having a wrap that was pre-sewn so I didn’t have to wrap a big long piece of cloth like with other wraps, but unfortunately I haven’t had much luck wearing my baby with this one!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and secure
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. I followed the size chart and it fit perfectly. I feel so secure and comfortable wearing my 6 week old. He stops crying almost instantly which is amazing. I have a couple of other wraps, that you have to tie yourself, and I just don’t feel confident in my tying abilities. customer_reviews.title: Great carrier
customer_reviews.text: I have carried my babies alot and the k'tan is great addittion to my collection of carriers. customer_reviews.author: melissa edri

customer_reviews.author: Skyla Robles

customer_reviews.author: Joanna Barbara

customer_reviews.author: Juliette Marshall
